summary: This is an email forwarding a Vanity Fair article discussing concerns about President Trump's politicization of the Department of Justice, specifically regarding the independence of the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and its ongoing investigations, including the Jeffrey Epstein case. The article highlights fears that political pressure could affect SDNY's probes into Trump associates.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Described as politicizing the Department of Justice, attempting to influence DOJ actions, and being a subject of SDNY investigations.

persons.name: Sally Yates
persons.context: Fired by Trump in 2017 for refusing to defend the travel ban; warned about Trump undermining DOJ independence.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Trump's AG accused of being protective of Trump and undermining the Mueller report; replaced the DOJ legal team on the census case.

persons.name: Sarah Fabian
persons.role: Senior Attorney, DOJ Office of Immigration Litigation
persons.context: Argued in court that it was 'safe and sanitary' for immigrant children to be without soap or toothbrushes; described as being thrown under the bus by Mike Pence.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.role: Vice President of the United States
persons.context: Mentioned as having thrown Sarah Fabian 'under the bus' after her controversial court argument became public.

persons.name: Joshua Gardner
persons.context: Expressed confusion during a court call after Trump's tweet about the census citizenship question, stating he first learned of Trump's position from the tweet.

persons.name: Emily Pierce
persons.role: Former Senior Adviser, DOJ under Obama
persons.context: Commentator on Trump's politicization of DOJ, citing the Arpaio pardon and use of the civil division for political purposes.

persons.name: Joe Arpaio
persons.context: Pardoned by Trump after being convicted of criminal contempt of court; cited as an example of Trump undermining court orders.

persons.name: Matthew Miller
persons.role: Former Justice Department Spokesman under Obama
persons.context: Commentator on Trump's politicization of DOJ and the role of AG Barr in spinning the Mueller report.

persons.name: Matthew Whitaker
persons.context: Reportedly asked by Trump about placing a loyalist in charge of SDNY investigations; denied under oath having such a conversation.

persons.name: Mimi Rocah
persons.role: Former Chief of SDNY Organized Crime Unit
persons.context: Commentator stating SDNY presents the greatest legal threat to Trump and expressing concern about political interference.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Billionaire charged by SDNY with sex trafficking; mentioned as a case currently putting SDNY in the headlines.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.role: Public Affairs, U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
persons.context: Sender of the email containing the article; listed with contact information for the SDNY Press Office.

persons.name: Chris Smith
persons.context: Author of the Vanity Fair article being forwarded in the email.

persons.name: Barack Obama
persons.role: Former President of the United States
persons.context: Mentioned as the administration under which Emily Pierce and Matthew Miller served at DOJ.

persons.name: Stormy Daniels
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to SDNY's investigation into Trump's role in paying her off.

persons.name: Thomas Hotelier
persons.context: Cited for analysis stating the census citizenship question would disadvantage Democrats.

connections.description: Trump appointed Barr as Attorney General; Barr is described as protective of Trump and willing to spin reports to help him.
Trump fired Yates as Acting Attorney General after she refused to defend the travel ban executive order.
Trump reportedly asked Whitaker about placing a loyalist in charge of SDNY investigations.
Implied connection as the article questions whether Trump would intercede if SDNY moved to indict his associates, with Epstein's case being handled by the same office.
Barr replaced Whitaker as Attorney General; both served as AG under Trump.
Pence is described as having thrown Fabian 'under the bus' after her controversial court argument.
Rocah, former SDNY organized crime chief, comments on the office's high-profile case charging Epstein.

events.title: Trump Travel Ban Executive Order
events.description: President Trump signed an executive order banning refugees and immigrants from seven majority-Muslim countries, leading to lawsuits and Sally Yates' firing.

events.title: Supreme Court Census Ruling
events.description: Supreme Court ruled against adding a citizenship question to the 2020 census, leading to confusion after Trump tweeted contrary to DOJ's position.

events.title: DOJ Legal Team Replaced on Census Case
events.description: Trump and Barr replaced the career DOJ legal team handling the census citizenship question case over a weekend.

events.title: Trump Asked Whitaker About SDNY Loyalist
events.description: Reported that Trump asked Acting AG Matthew Whitaker whether a loyalist could be put in charge of SDNY investigations; Whitaker denied under oath.

events.title: SDNY Charges Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Southern District of New York charged billionaire Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking, putting the office back in the headlines.

keyFacts: The Vanity Fair article expresses concern that President Trump's politicization of the DOJ could threaten the independence of the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
SDNY is investigating Trump's role in paying off Stormy Daniels, Deutsche Bank loans to Trump, Trump's inaugural committee finances, and had recently charged Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking.
In February 2019, it was reported that Trump asked Acting AG Matthew Whitaker about placing a loyalist in charge of SDNY's investigations, which Whitaker denied under oath.
The article highlights fears that Attorney General William Barr, being protective of Trump, might not need explicit instructions to interfere with SDNY's work against Trump's associates.
The document is an email forwarded by Nicholas Biase of the SDNY Public Affairs office, distributing a media article critical of DOJ politicization.
